name: The Game of Hearts Quiz / Test | Card Games | 10 Questions

questions.text: How many people usually play a game of hearts with one deck?
questions.explanation:
4.

	If you play with more, you'll need two decks of cards.

questions.text: How many cards do you discard when you pass them to another player?
questions.explanation:
3.

	Rather obviously, you try to get rid of what you don't want in your hand- high spade cards, for example.

questions.text: Which card, if you take it, is worth 13 points?
questions.explanation:
The Queen of Spades.

	This is not a good thing in Hearts!

questions.text: Which cards, if you take them, are worth 1 point each?
questions.explanation:
Hearts.

	That is, of course, how the game got its name.

questions.text: In a popular rules variation, the player holding which card plays first?
questions.explanation:
The 2 of clubs.

	This is by no means universal- "eldest hand"- the first-dealt-to player- is another common variant.

questions.text: What is it called when someone manages to collect every trick that is worth points?
questions.explanation:
Shooting the moon.

	This usually allows the person to choose to either subtract 26 points from his score or add 26 points to everyone else's score.

questions.text: What card will always take a trick?
questions.correct: The highest card in the suit led
options: The lowest card in the suit led
questions.explanation:
The highest card in the suit led.

	The ace is the high card in Hearts.

questions.text: To how many points is a usual Hearts game played?
questions.explanation:
100.

	Variations are possible for a longer or shorter game.

questions.text: What is the proper passing order for discards?
questions.correct: To the left, to the right, across, hold
options: To the right, to the left, across, hold
To the left, to the right, hold, across
To the right, to the left, hold, across
questions.explanation:
To the left, to the right, across, hold.

	So, for one of four hands, you must keep what you were dealt!

questions.correct: A hand where you do not discard any cards
options: A hand where you may not take a trick
A hand with all good cards
A hand you want to keep
questions.explanation:
A hand where you do not discard any cards.

	Of course, it's always the one that has the worst cards...
